subject: Mathematics - Symplectic Geometry
Mathematical Physics
creator: Jurdjevic, Velimir
title:
Integrable Hamiltonian systems on symmetric spaces: Jacobi, Kepler and
  Moser
description:
This paper defines a class of variational problems on Lie groups that admit
involutive automorphisms. The maximum Principle of optimal control then
identifies the appropriate left invariant Hamiltonians on the Lie algebra of
the group. The corresponding Hamiltonian equations admit a spectral
representation with important applications to the theory of integrable systems.
Particular cases make a link to Moser's work relating the solutions of Kepler's
problem to the geodesics on spaces of constant curvature, Newmann's mechanical
problem on the sphere and related geodesic problem of Jacobi on an ellipsoid.

subject: Mathematics - Numerical Analysis
creator: Yaşar, Meral
Bozkurt, Durmuş
title: An Inversion Algorithm for Cyclic Nonadiagonal Matrix
description:
In this paper, we compose a computational algorithm for the determinant and
the inverse of the n x n cyclic nonadiagonal matrix. The algorithm is suited
for implementation using computer algebra systems (CAS) such as Mathematica and
Maple.
